snippet: The onslaught of young grandmasters is the result of the development of strong chess computers that can be used for training as well as the creation of databases and the Internet.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column holds that onslaught of young grandmasters is result of development of strong chess computers that can be used for training as well as creation of databases and Internet.
lead_paragraph: The onslaught of young grandmasters is the result of the development of strong chess computers that can be used for training as well as the creation of databases and the Internet.

headline.print_headline: In the Digital Age, More Prodigies?
headline.seo: In Digital Age, More Chess Prodigies Than Ever
headline.main: In the Digital Age, More Prodigies?
